mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reports on a disturbance at the University of Virginia in which 14 masked and intoxicated students disturbed the peace and insulted some professors who attempted to intervene; the Board of Visitors expelled three and punished the rest to a lesser degree, and order is restored; Jefferson considers the treatment of the Creeks and Cherokees by the Georgia government as "most scandalous."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1825 October 14, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to William Short, Philadelphia, [Pennsylvania].
